column4: I am not having luck changing my window manager in 10.04. I've tried a couple settings in gconf-editor and I've tried using the option at the bottom of the gdm login screen. I'm trying to use "dwm" -- a simple window manager. Any tips?
its likely you have to log off and after putting in your password before hitting enter,, change the session to dwm
you could also try in terminal  dwm --replac & disown
rather    dwm --replace & disown
coz: odd. dwm doesn't have a --replace. I'
ll try the login method you propose.
then log off and try changing the session to dwm
I had no luck with that. I chose my user, typed password, changed the wm option to dwm, and pressed enter.
then you may have to check online about this,, I have not used dwm  so I may have it all wrong
thank you.
let me search ,, hold on
i'd love to hear what you find. I certainly have looked. A lot of the advise doesn't seem possible due to various differences between instructions and what I see here on my desktop.
did you see this?    http://aclindsay.com/blog/2011/04/installing-dwm-and-killing-gdm-on-ubuntu/
you might also want to   sudo apt-get install dwm-tools
no. but the way he describes it, it just worked. Other discussion involves not booting to gdm at all (i.e. startup with a basic console login)
understood...as I said I know little about this,, have you looked into xmonad?
i just looked it up. Looks like an interesting alternative.
thanks for your help.

for the record, I got it to work by switching to xdm and using it's simple mechanism for WM choice of modifying ~/.Xsession
